info.title: Uberoo API
info.description:
To manage restaurants, menus, delivery people and orders with the Uberoo REST API.  
You can find out more about Uberoo at [http://uberoo.eat](uberoo.eat).

# Authentication
## JWT
To authenticate you need to send a `Bearer <JWT>` token in the `Authorization` header.  
To find more information about JWT, you can find out more at [https://jwt.io](https://jwt.io).  
You can generate a JWT token using the `/account/login` endpoint.

tags.name: foods
tags.description: Manage foods and menus of restaurants

get.description: Retrieve all the information about all the restaurants

parameters.name: is_open
parameters.description: Filter restaurants by their open status (based on the current time)

parameters.name: nearest
parameters.description: Filter restaurants by their distance from a specified location.\n The specified location is specified by longitude and latitude. The distance is specified in meters.

schema.description: The longitude and latitude of the location to use as the center of the search. The longitude is in the range [-180,180] and the latitude is in the range [-90,90]. The default is the current location of the client.

204.description: The query was successful but no restaurants were found

post.description: Create a new restaurant. The restaurant will not be returned in the response

tag.description: A list of tag of the restaurant

openingHours.description: The opening hours of the restaurant

items.description: Format day:hour with 0 for monday and 0,23 for hours

delete.description: Deletes the restaurant with the specified ID

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

post.description: Add a food item to the cart of the user passed in the path

foodId.description: The id of the food to add. Check Food schema for more information.

put.summary: Update or create the cart of the user passed in the path
put.description:
Update or create the cart of the user passed in the path and return the updated cart.
If an item does not exist, it will be created.
If an item exists, it will be updated.
If an item is not present (anymore) in the list, it will be deleted.

userId.name: userId

foodId.name: foodId
foodId.description: The id of the food to retrieve. Check Food schema for more information.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The numbers of items to return

order.name: order
order.description: The order of returned data (asc or desc)

filter.name: filter
filter.description:
The filter to apply to the data (e.g. 'name:John'). We can use :
- 'or' operator to combine filters (e.g. 'name:John or name:Doe').
- 'and' operator to combine filters (e.g. 'name:Doe and firstname:John').
- '\*' wildcard operator to match any string (e.g. 'name:John\*' will match 'John' and 'John Doe')

tag.description: A list of tag of the restaurant

openingHours.description: The opening hours of the restaurant

items.description: Format day:hour with 0 for monday and 0,23 for hours

Cart.description: The cart of the user who can be only a 'consumer'

items.description: The list of items to order

total.description: The total price of the basket

createdAt.description: The date of creation of the basket

updatedAt.description: The date of update of the basket

firstName.description: The first name of the user

lastName.description: The last name of the user

createdAt.description: The date of creation of the user

Order.description:
Represents a food.  
When a food is added to the cart, and the customer validate the order, a new order is create.

customerId.description: The id of the customer who made the order.

courierId.description: The id of the courier who is handling the order. By default, the order is not handled.

restaurantId.description: The id of the restaurant that serves the food

foods.description: The list of foods in the order

total.description: The total price of the order

acceptedAt.description: The date of the creation of the order

preparingTime.description: The time it takes to prepare the order (in minutes)

deliveryTime.description: The time it takes to deliver the order to the customer (in minutes)

deliveredAt.description: The date of the delivery of the order

canceledAt.description: The date of the cancellation of the order. By default, the order is not canceled.

paymentId.description: The payment of the order (by default, the order is not paid)
